documentType: prison count sheet and inmate roster
summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and inmate rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated July 24, 2019. It includes official inmate counts by housing unit, an out-count form, and specific inmate roster entries, including one for an inmate assigned to suicide watch.

persons.name: Harrison
persons.context: Listed on an inmate roster for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, assigned as a 'TWN DRIVER' (likely transport or work detail).

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Listed on an inmate roster for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with an assignment category of 'HOSP' and a work code for 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', indicating placement on suicide watch or unassigned status.

events.title: Daily Prison Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, documenting the census by housing unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated July 24, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death on July 25, 2019.
An inmate named Bullock is listed with an assignment code for 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', indicating protocols for monitoring inmates at risk were in place at the facility.
The documents show standard Bureau of Prisons administrative procedures for inmate counts and roster management.
The total inmate census recorded was 774, with a verify count of 772.
The documents are official prison forms, not legal case files, providing a snapshot of facility operations on a specific date.
